tool.name: NeuralNetworkOutputFiles

param.name: inputraster
param.dialogReference: This is the Unique Conditions Raster made to combine all of the evidence before using the neural network tools.

param.name: rbfnfile
param.dialogReference:
This is the results of the RBFLN classification of the evidence from the Unique Conditions Raster (the evidence) and the training sites.

It is best to browse for the file in order to include the full path.

param.name: pnnfile
param.dialogReference:
This is the results of the PNN classification of the evidence from the Unique Conditions Raster (the evidence) and the training sites.

It is best to browse for the file in order to include the full path.

param.name: fuzfile
param.dialogReference:
This is the results of the Fuzzy Neural Network classification of the evidence from the Unique Conditions Raster (the evidence) and the training sites.

It is best to browse for the file in order to include the full path.

param.name: resulttable
param.dialogReference:
This is the DBF table that can be joined to the Unique Conditions Raster and symbolized by membership in the RBFLN, PNN, or Fuzzy Neural Network.

When naming the DBF file, it is required that the name include the extension ".DBF", for example the output results table might be NN1_results.dbf.

param.name: outputraster
param.dialogReference: This is the response raster with all the unique combination of the evidence and the membership results from GeoXplore.

tool.summary:
This tool reads the ASCII files created by GeoXplore (the neural network response or classification) and converts them to DBF files that are joined to the Unique Conditions Raster mapping the combinations of the evidence. This data are then made permanent in the Output Conditions Raster. Note the response from the RBFLN, PNN, and Fuzzy Neural Net Patterns is membership in the training sites.

The neural networks results DBF file created by this tool is automatically joined to the combined evidence raster and a the final response raster is created that contains all the neural net results. The user can then select what results are to be symbolized. The user may have applied any one or all of the three methods in the neural net. So there could be an Radial Basis Function Neural Net (RBFLN), Probabilistic Neural Net (PNN), and/or Fuzzy Neural Net (Fuzzy Clusters and Pattern memberships) results.

  • To symbolize on the RBFLN result, select the attribute RBFLN. Good results will be obtained by symbolizing with Natural Breaks.

  • To symboliize on the PNN results, select the PNN attribute. Good results are obtained using Quantile symbolization.

  • To symbolize on the results of the Fuzzy Neural Netwok, there are several approaches to symbolization. The first is to symbolize on FzzyClstr (Fuzzy Cluster) using the Unique method of symbolization. The Fuzzy Cluster is the cluster in which each cell has the highest membership. These clusters are the natural clusters defined by the data.

  • The second method of symbolization for the Fuzzy Neural Network is to symbolize on the membership in a cluster. This information is stored in the Pat# attributes. So PAT1 is the membership in cluster 1. The user can determine which cluster is of most interest and then look at the spatial distribution of membership in that most interesting cluster. Symbolization by Natural Breaks generally gives good results.

  • Another interesting thing to do is to make a color or band composite map of membership in several clusters. See the entry in Color Composite section below for doing this operation.
tool.usage:
• It is not required that all the methods be used. Often it is convenient to only use one neural network method that is most applicable to the specific probem.

  • The RBFLN and PNN return fuzzy membership in the training sites. This should be a number between [0,1]. If the membership is outside this range, it indicates a weak classification. This weakness is acceptable if the value is close to 1; but a maximum membership significantly larger than one, for example 2.0, indicates a very poor classification that should be considered unreliable. Unacceptable training can occur because of a poor training set or inappropriate use of the training parameters.

  • The Fuzzy Neural Network returns two parameters, the Clusters and the Pattern Membership. The Clusters defines for each cell the cluster with which that cell has the greatest membership. The Pattern Membership (PAT1, PAT2, etc.) is the membership in each pattern or cluster. Depending on your applications, both Cluster and Pattern Membership can be useful symbolizations.

Color Composite of Fuzzy Neural Net Pattern membershps

Often it is useful to make a color combination of various pattern memberships. To do this it is first necessary to use the Lookup (sa) tool to create rasters of the desired Pattern Memberships. Then use the Composite Bands tool to create a single raster with multiple bands that can be symbolized in a color composite.

Evaluation of Response

Often it is useful to evaluate the Response from the Neural Nets to measure how well the Neural Net classified the training sets or how well the Neural Net predicted new sites. The Area Frequency tool in the Weights of Evidence toolbox is useful for this. See the Help file of the Area Frequency tool for guidance on the required preprocessing.
